segment.source: As new Windows updates become available, add them to your image.
segment.target: As new Windows updates become available, add them to your image.

segment.source: Lab 2c: Servicing the image with Windows Updates
segment.target: Lab 2c: Servicing the image with Windows Updates

segment.source: Lab 2c: Servicing the image with Windows Updates
segment.target: Lab 2c: Servicing the image with Windows Updates

segment.source: As new Windows updates become available, add them to your image.
segment.target: As new Windows updates become available, add them to your image.

segment.source: By default, updates installed after a target rollup update are not restored.
segment.target: By default, updates installed after a target rollup update are not restored.

segment.source: To ensure that updates preinstalled during manufacturing are not discarded after recovery, they should be marked as permanent by using the /Cleanup-Image command in DISM with the /StartComponentCleanup and /ResetBase options.
segment.target: To ensure that updates preinstalled during manufacturing are not discarded after recovery, they should be marked as permanent by using the /Cleanup-Image command in DISM with the /StartComponentCleanup and /ResetBase options.

segment.source: Updates marked as permanent are always restored during recovery.
segment.target: Updates marked as permanent are always restored during recovery.

segment.source: Step 1: Mount the Windows image file
segment.target: Step 1: Mount the Windows image file

segment.source: Run the following commands:
segment.target: Run the following commands:

segment.source: Where /Index:1 refers to the image you want to mount.
segment.target: Where /Index:1 refers to the image you want to mount.

segment.source: Note, rem use /Index:2 to mount the Windows 10 Home edition from the default Windows 10 Home/Pro edition.
segment.target: Note, rem use /Index:2 to mount the Windows 10 Home edition from the default Windows 10 Home/Pro edition.

segment.source: Step 2: Add the Windows update package
segment.target: Step 2: Add the Windows update package

segment.source: From Microsoft Connect, download the Windows update.
segment.target: From Microsoft Connect, download the Windows update.

segment.source: Save this in the folder: C:WindowsUpdates.
segment.target: Save this in the folder: C:WindowsUpdates.

segment.source: Add the updates to the image.
segment.target: Add the updates to the image.

segment.source: For packages with dependencies, make sure you install the packages in order.
segment.target: For packages with dependencies, make sure you install the packages in order.

segment.source: If you’re not sure of the dependencies, it’s OK to put them all in the same folder, and then add them all using the same DISM /Add-Package command.
segment.target: If you’re not sure of the dependencies, it’s OK to put them all in the same folder, and then add them all using the same DISM /Add-Package command.

segment.source: where C is the drive letter of the drive and , , and are update packages that you’re adding to the image.
segment.target: where C is the drive letter of the drive and , , and are update packages that you’re adding to the image.

segment.source: Lock in the updates, so that they are restored during a recovery.
segment.target: Lock in the updates, so that they are restored during a recovery.

segment.source: Step 3: Unmount the images
segment.target: Step 3: Unmount the images

segment.source: Close all applications that might access files from the image.
segment.target: Close all applications that might access files from the image.

segment.target: Commit the changes and unmount the Windows image:
